verses.verse: And it came to pass after <S%H310><s%> these things <S%H1697><s%>, that the butler <S%H8248><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> and his baker <S%H644><s%> had offended <S%H2398><s%> their lord <S%H113><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>.

And Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> was wroth <S%H7107><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> of his officers <S%H5631><s%>, against the chief <S%H8269><s%> of the butlers <S%H8248><s%>, and against the chief <S%H8269><s%> of the bakers <S%H644><s%>.

And he put <S%H5414><s%> them in ward <S%H4929><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of the captain <S%H8269><s%> of the guard <S%H2876><s%>, into the prison <S%H1004><s%> <S%H5470><s%>, the place <S%H4725><s%> where Joseph <S%H3130><s%> was bound <S%H631><s%>.

And the captain <S%H8269><s%> of the guard <S%H2876><s%> charged <S%H6485><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%> with them, and he served <S%H8334><s%> them: and they continued a season <S%H3117><s%> in ward <S%H4929><s%>.

And they dreamed <S%H2492><s%> a dream <S%H2472><s%> both of them <S%H8147><s%>, each man <S%H376><s%> his dream <S%H2472><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> night <S%H3915><s%>, each man <S%H376><s%> according to the interpretation <S%H6623><s%> of his dream <S%H2472><s%>, the butler <S%H8248><s%> and the baker <S%H644><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, which were bound <S%H631><s%> in the prison <S%H1004><s%> <S%H5470><s%>.
And Joseph <S%H3130><s%> came in <S%H935><s%> unto them in the morning <S%H1242><s%>, and looked <S%H7200><s%> upon them, and, behold, they were sad <S%H2196><s%>.

And he asked <S%H7592><s%> Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> officers <S%H5631><s%> that were with him in the ward <S%H4929><s%> of his lord's <S%H113><s%> house <S%H1004><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Wherefore look <S%H6440><s%> ye so sadly <S%H7451><s%> to day <S%H3117><s%>? look: Heb. are your faces evil?

And they said <S%H559><s%> unto him, We have dreamed <S%H2492><s%> a dream <S%H2472><s%>, and there is no interpreter <S%H6622><s%> of it. And Joseph <S%H3130><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto them, Do not interpretations <S%H6623><s%> belong to God <S%H430><s%>? tell me <S%H5608><s%> them, I pray you.

And the chief <S%H8269><s%> butler <S%H8248><s%> told <S%H5608><s%> his dream <S%H2472><s%> to Joseph <S%H3130><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> to him, In my dream <S%H2472><s%>, behold, a vine <S%H1612><s%> was before me <S%H6440><s%>;

And in the vine <S%H1612><s%> were three <S%H7969><s%> branches <S%H8299><s%>: and it was as though it budded <S%H6524><s%>, and her blossoms <S%H5322><s%> shot forth <S%H5927><s%>; and the clusters <S%H811><s%> thereof brought forth ripe <S%H1310><s%> grapes <S%H6025><s%>:

And Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> cup <S%H3563><s%> was in my hand <S%H3027><s%>: and I took <S%H3947><s%> the grapes <S%H6025><s%>, and pressed <S%H7818><s%> them into Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> cup <S%H3563><s%>, and I gave <S%H5414><s%> the cup <S%H3563><s%> into Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> hand <S%H3709><s%>.
And Joseph <S%H3130><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him, This is the interpretation <S%H6623><s%> of it: The three <S%H7969><s%> branches <S%H8299><s%> are three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>:

Yet <S%H5750><s%> within three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> shall Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> lift up <S%H5375><s%> thine head <S%H7218><s%>, and restore <S%H7725><s%> thee unto thy place <S%H3653><s%>: and thou shalt deliver <S%H5414><s%> Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> cup <S%H3563><s%> into his hand <S%H3027><s%>, after the former <S%H7223><s%> manner <S%H4941><s%> when thou wast his butler <S%H8248><s%>. lift: or, reckon

But think <S%H2142><s%> on me when it shall be well <S%H3190><s%> with thee, and shew <S%H6213><s%> kindness <S%H2617><s%>, I pray thee, unto me, and make mention <S%H2142><s%> of me unto Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>, and bring me <S%H3318><s%> out of this house <S%H1004><s%>: think: Heb. remember me with thee

For indeed I was stolen away <S%H1589><s%> out of the land <S%H776><s%> of the Hebrews <S%H5680><s%>: and here also have I done <S%H6213><s%> nothing <S%H3972><s%> that they should put <S%H7760><s%> me into the dungeon <S%H953><s%>.

When the chief <S%H8269><s%> baker <S%H644><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that the interpretation <S%H6622><s%> was good <S%H2896><s%>, he said <S%H559><s%> unto Joseph <S%H3130><s%>, I also <S%H637><s%> was in my dream <S%H2472><s%>, and, behold, I had three <S%H7969><s%> white <S%H2751><s%> baskets <S%H5536><s%> on my head <S%H7218><s%>: white: or, full of holes

And in the uppermost <S%H5945><s%> basket <S%H5536><s%> there was of all manner <S%H3978><s%> of bakemeats <S%H4639><s%> <S%H644><s%> for Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>; and the birds <S%H5775><s%> did eat <S%H398><s%> them out of the basket <S%H5536><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> my head <S%H7218><s%>. bakemeats: Heb. meat of Pharaoh, the work of a baker, or, cook

And Joseph <S%H3130><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%>, This is the interpretation <S%H6623><s%> thereof: The three <S%H7969><s%> baskets <S%H5536><s%> are three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>:

Yet within three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> shall Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> lift up <S%H5375><s%> thy head <S%H7218><s%> from off thee, and shall hang <S%H8518><s%> thee on a tree <S%H6086><s%>; and the birds <S%H5775><s%> shall eat <S%H398><s%> thy flesh <S%H1320><s%> from off thee. lift: or, reckon thee, and take thy office from thee

And it came to pass the third <S%H7992><s%> day <S%H3117><s%>, which was Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> birthday <S%H3117><s%> <S%H3205><s%>, that he made <S%H6213><s%> a feast <S%H4960><s%> unto all his servants <S%H5650><s%>: and he lifted up <S%H5375><s%> the head <S%H7218><s%> of the chief <S%H8269><s%> butler <S%H8248><s%> and of the chief <S%H8269><s%> baker <S%H644><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> his servants <S%H5650><s%>. lifted: or, reckoned

And he restored <S%H7725><s%> the chief <S%H8269><s%> butler <S%H8248><s%> unto his butlership <S%H4945><s%> again <S%H7725><s%>; and he gave <S%H5414><s%> the cup <S%H3563><s%> into Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> hand <S%H3709><s%>:
But he hanged <S%H8518><s%> the chief <S%H8269><s%> baker <S%H644><s%>: as Joseph <S%H3130><s%> had interpreted <S%H6622><s%> to them.
Yet did not the chief <S%H8269><s%> butler <S%H8248><s%> remember <S%H2142><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%>, but forgat <S%H7911><s%> him.
